Record Class GameConfig

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Record
com.gr15.pacman.model.GameConfig
Record Components:
initialBoard - The initial layout of the game board.
powerModeDuration - Duration (in seconds) that Pac-Man remains in power mode after consuming a power item.
lives - The number of lives Pacman starts with.
ghostSpeed - The speed of the ghosts.
pacmanSpeed - The speed of Pacman
numberOfItems - The number of collectible items on the board.
pacmanStartPosition - The starting Position of Pacman.
redGhostStartPosition - The starting Position of the red ghost.
blueGhostStartPosition - The starting Position of the blue ghost.
pinkGhostStartPosition - The starting Position of the pink ghost.
orangeGhostStartPosition - The starting Position of the orange ghost.
public record GameConfig(GameState.TileType[][] initialBoard, double powerModeDuration, int lives, double ghostSpeed, double pacmanSpeed, int numberOfItems, Position pacmanStartPosition, Position redGhostStartPosition, Position blueGhostStartPosition, Position pinkGhostStartPosition, Position orangeGhostStartPosition) extends Record
Represents the configuration for a Pac-Man-style game. This class is immutable and ensures defensive copying of the initial game board to maintain data integrity.

      public GameConfig(GameState.TileType[][] initialBoard, double powerModeDuration, int lives, double ghostSpeed, double pacmanSpeed, int numberOfItems, Position pacmanStartPosition, Position redGhostStartPosition, Position blueGhostStartPosition, Position pinkGhostStartPosition, Position orangeGhostStartPosition)
      Constructs a new GameConfig record. Performs a deep copy of the initial board to ensure immutability.

  • Method Details

    • initialBoard

      public GameState.TileType[][] initialBoard()
      Returns a deep copy of the initial board configuration. This prevents external modification of the board data.
      Returns:
      A deep copy of the initial board.

    • equals

      public final boolean equals(Object o)
      Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one. The objects are equal if the other object is of the same class and if all the record components are equal. Reference components are compared with Objects::equals(Object,Object); primitive components are compared with the compare method from their corresponding wrapper classes.
      Specified by:

      Parameters:
